that I use for a square base take some dollar-store foam board and
cut out a one-inch square you may want to do one inch light or even fifteen

halfway across this square and score the foam but do not cut through the paper on

your hot glue gun is fully hot and apply a thin bead of hot glue in the crack

position while the glue cools this was the purpose of that 1/8 inch tab to have
material to bite into the glue but still have the figures feet be visible at the
surface of the base hot glue a penny or washer to the bottom this will both
reinforce the base to keep it straight and add a lot of weight
